issues.description: The solution’s checkOrderReady method returns a boolean, but the problem specification and UML diagram define checkOrderReady() to return void. This mismatch in return type could cause students’ implementations to diverge from the reference and break any automated tests expecting a void return.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the signature of checkOrderReady in SealSaloon.java to return void instead of boolean, and remove its return statements so it aligns with the problem specification.
